item.title: Indonesia ‘conditionally’ lifts ban on Grok
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Indonesia has followed Malaysia and the Philippines in lifting a ban on xAI’s chatbot Grok.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: The great Tesla rebranding
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: India offers zero taxes through 2047 to lure global AI workloads
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: New Delhi's latest move comes as Amazon, Google, and Microsoft expand data center investments in India.

item.title: Bye-bye corporate conglomerates. Hello personal conglomerates.
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Elon Musk's reported merging of SpaceX, xAI, and Tesla harkens back to the heyday of General Electric — or maybe the robber barons of the Gilded Age.

item.title: Meet the new European unicorns of 2026
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: From Belgium to Ukraine, five fresh European unicorns were minted this January.

item.title: Waymo reportedly raising a $16B funding round
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Waymo is reportedly finalizing a new funding round that will value the robotaxi company at $110 billion.

item.title: SpaceX seeks federal approval to launch 1 million solar-powered satellite data centers
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: SpaceX's filing claims these satellites will be “a first step towards becoming a Kardashev II-level civilization — one that can harness the Sun’s full power."

item.title: Nvidia CEO pushes back against report that his company’s $100B OpenAI investment has stalled
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said that a recent report of friction between his company and OpenAI was “nonsense.”

item.title: HomeBoost’s app will show you where to save on your utility bills
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The startup is partnering with utilities to help homeowners determine the best upgrades to cut their energy use.

item.title: a16z partner Kofi Ampadu to leave firm after TxO program pause
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Ampadu's departure perhaps signals the end of the TxO chapter. The fund and program focused on supporting underserved founders by providing access to tech networks and investment capital through a donor-advised fund.

item.title: A peek inside Physical Intelligence, the startup building Silicon Valley’s buzziest robot brains
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: If co-founder Lachy Groom has any doubts, he doesn’t show it. He’s working with people who've been working on this problem for decades and who believe the timing is finally right, which is all he needs to know.

item.title: OnlyFans considering selling majority stake to Architect Capital
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: This isn't the first time in recent memory that OnlyFans has been in talks to sell off its business.

item.title: OpenClaw’s AI assistants are now building their own social network
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: The viral personal AI assistant formerly known as Clawdbot has a new shell — again. After briefly rebranding as Moltbot, it has now picked OpenClaw as its new name.

item.title: Informant told FBI that Jeffrey Epstein had a ‘personal hacker’
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The hacker allegedly developed zero-day exploits and offensive cyber tools and sold them to several countries, including an unnamed central African government, the U.K., and the United States.

item.title: Instagram might soon let you remove yourself from someone’s Close Friends list
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Since the feature's launch in 2018, users haven't been able to remove themselves from someone else's Close Friends list.

item.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on the moon
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The company is trying to take advantage of President Donald Trump's desire to return astronauts to the lunar surface by the end of his term.

item.title: SpaceX’s IPO could open the floodgates — and secondaries are booming in the meantime
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: To unpack what SpaceX’s IPO chatter means, how private liquidity works before a debut, and what investors are looking for in today’s pre-IPO giants, we spoke with Greg Martin, managing director at Rainmaker Securities, a broker-dealer specializing in secondary share transactions for late-stage private companies.

item.title: Uber is literally in the driver’s seat when it comes to AV bets
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Self-driving truck startup Waabi’s billion-dollar fundraise isn’t just about trucks.   The deal, for $750 million up front plus another $250 million from Uber tied to deployment milestones, marks a major expansion into robotaxis for the company founded by former Uber AI chief Raquel Urtasun. It also feels like another chip from Uber on the autonomous vehicle roulette table. With more […]

item.title: Anthropic brings agentic plug-ins to Cowork
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The company says you can use plug-ins to "tell Claude how you like work done, which tools and data to pull from, how to handle critical workflows, and what slash commands to expose so your team gets more consistent outcomes."

item.title: Bluesky issues its first transparency report, noting rise in user reports and legal demands
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Bluesky's first transparency reports tackle moderation, regulatory compliance, account takedowns, and more. The number of government legal requests went up fivefold.
